hints.content:
We can think of $\purpleC{63}$ as $\purpleC{6\text{ tens}}$ and $\purpleC{3 \text{ ones}}$.  

We can think of $\blueD{11}$ as $\blueD{1\text{ ten}}$ and $\blueD{1\text{ one}}$.

$\phantom{=}\purpleC{63}+\blueD{11}$

$=\purpleC{6\text{ tens}}+\purpleC{3\text{ ones}}+\blueD{1\text{ ten}}+\blueD{1\text{ one}}$

$= \purpleC{6\text{ tens}}+\blueD{1\text{ ten}}+\purpleC{3\text{ ones}}+\blueD{1\text{ one}}$
The answer: $6 \text{ tens}+1\text{ ten} +3\text{ ones}+1 \text{ one}$

question.content:
**Which of the following is equal to $63+11$ ?**
